<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark if the registrant is a
well-known seasoned issuer, as defined in Rule&nbsp;405 of the Securities Act.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Yes&nbsp;<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></u></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;No&nbsp;<i><u style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></i></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark if the registrant is not
required to file reports pursuant to Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d)&nbsp;of the Act.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Yes&nbsp;<i><u style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></i>&nbsp;No
&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant (1)&nbsp;has
filed all reports required to be filed by Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d)&nbsp;of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12&nbsp;months (or for
such shorter period that the registrant was required to file such reports), and
(2)&nbsp;has been subject to such filing requirements for the past
90&nbsp;days.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Yes&nbsp;<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></u></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No&nbsp;<i><u style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></i></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark if disclosure of delinquent
filers pursuant to Item 405 of Regulation&nbsp;S-K is not contained herein, and
will not be contained, to the best of registrant&#146;s knowledge, in definitive
proxy or information statements incorporated by reference in Part&nbsp;III of
this Form&nbsp;10-K or any amendment to this Form&nbsp;10-K. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[</font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">]</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is a
large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, or a non-accelerated filer. See
definition of &#147;accelerated filer and large accelerated filer&#148; in Rule&nbsp;12b-2
of the Exchange Act.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Large Accelerated Filer &nbsp;</font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Accelerated Filer<i>&nbsp;<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u>  </i>Non-accelerated
Filer<i>&nbsp;<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></i></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is a
shell company (as defined in Rule&nbsp;12b-2 of the Exchange Act). </font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Yes&nbsp;<i><u style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></i>&nbsp;No
&nbsp;<u>&nbsp;&nbsp;</u></font></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&#252;</font></u></b><b><u><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">The aggregate market value of the 1,465,928,862
shares of voting stock held by nonaffiliates of the registrant, computed by
reference to the closing price as reported on the New York Stock Exchange, as
of the last business day of Abbott Laboratories&#146; most recently completed second
fiscal quarter (June&nbsp;30, 2006), was approximately $63,929,157,671. Abbott
has no non-voting common equity.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.5pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Number of common shares outstanding as of January&nbsp;31,
2007: 1,543,073,501</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;">DOCUMENTS
INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:bold;">Portions of the 2007 Abbott
Laboratories Proxy Statement are incorporated by reference into Part&nbsp;III.
The Proxy Statement will be filed on or about March&nbsp;19, 2007.</font></b></p>


 <div style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 6.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;"> <p style="border:none;line-height:6.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;padding:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> </div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;I<a name="Parti_094334"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM&nbsp;1.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BUSINESS<a name="Item1_Business_094335"></a></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">GENERAL DEVELOPMENT
OF BUSINESS<a name="GeneralDevelopmentOfBusiness_094337"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott Laboratories is an
Illinois corporation, incorporated in 1900. Abbott&#146;s* principal business is the
discovery, development, manufacture, and sale of a broad and diversified line
of health care products.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">FINANCIAL
INFORMATION RELATING TO INDUSTRY SEGMENTS, GEOGRAPHIC&nbsp;AREAS,&nbsp;AND&nbsp;CLASSES
OF SIMILAR PRODUCTS<a name="FinancialInformationRelatingToInd_094358"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Incorporated herein by
reference is Note&nbsp;6 entitled &#147;Segment and Geographic Area Information&#148; of
the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements included under Item&nbsp;8, &#147;Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NARRATIVE
DESCRIPTION OF BUSINESS<a name="NarrativeDescriptionOfBusiness_094412"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Abbott has four reportable revenue segments:
Pharmaceutical Products, Diagnostic Products, Nutritional Products, and
Vascular Products. Abbott also has a 50&nbsp;percent owned joint venture, TAP
Pharmaceutical Products Inc. During the first half of 2006, Abbott acquired the
vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses of Guidant
Corporation. Effective with this acquisition, Abbott&#146;s base vascular business
and the acquired Guidant businesses are reported as the Vascular Products
segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2006, Abbott acquired Kos
Pharmaceuticals,&nbsp;Inc., a specialty pharmaceutical company that developed
and marketed proprietary medications for the treatment of cardiovascular,
metabolic and respiratory diseases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 205.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2007,
Abbott announced that it had entered into a definitive agreement to sell Abbott&#146;s
core laboratory diagnostic businesses, including point of care, to General
Electric Company (&#147;GE&#148;) for $8.13 billion, in cash. This divestiture does not
include Abbott&#146;s Molecular Diagnostics and Diabetes Care businesses. The sale
is expected to close in the first half of 2007 and is subject to customary
closing conditions, including regulatory approvals.</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As used
throughout the text of this report on Form&nbsp;10-K, the term &#147;Abbott&#148;
refers to Abbott Laboratories, an Illinois corporation, or Abbott Laboratories
and its consolidated subsidiaries, as the context requires.</p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\fc\5212583598_D11263_1741329\1583-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb 21 12:59 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pharmaceutical
Products<a name="PharmaceuticalProducts_094435"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Pharmaceutical Products segment&#146;s products include
a broad line of adult and pediatric pharmaceuticals manufactured, marketed and
sold worldwide, which are sold primarily on the prescription, or
recommendation, of physicians. In 2006, Abbott announced a collaboration with
AstraZeneca to co-develop and market a fixed-dose combination lipid
management therapy of Crestor&#174; (rosuvastatin/AstraZeneca) with either Tricor&#174;
(Abbott&#146;s fenofibrate) or Abbott&#146;s next generation fenofibrate, ABT&nbsp;335.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The principal
products included in the Pharmaceutical Products segment are:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>TriCor&#174;, for the treatment
of dyslipidemia;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Niaspan&#174;, for the treatment
of high cholesterol;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>HUMIRA&#174;, for the treatment
of rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
anti-infectives clarithromycin (sold under the trademarks Biaxin&#174;, Klacid&#174; and
Klaricid&#174;), Omnicef&#174;, an oral cephalosporin antibiotic, tosufloxacin, sold in
Japan under the trademark Tosuxacin&#174;, and various forms of the antibiotic
erythromycin, sold primarily as PCE&#174; or polymer-coated erythromycin,
Erythrocin&#174;, and E.E.S.&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Synthroid&#174;, for the
treatment of hypothyroidism;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Meridia&#174;
and Reductil&#174; (also marketed as Reductyl&#153; and Reductal&#153;)<u>  </u>for the treatment of obesity;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
anti-virals Kaletra&#174; and Norvir&#174;, protease inhibitors for the treatment of HIV
infection;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Depakote&#174;,
an agent for the treatment of epilepsy and bipolar disorder and the prevention
of migraines;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
anesthesia products sevoflurane (sold in the United States under the trademark
Ultane&#174;<u>  </u>and outside of the United States
primarily under the trademark Sevorane&#174; and in a few other markets as Ultane&#174;),
isoflurane, and enflurane;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
specialty injectables Zemplar&#174;, for the treatment of hyperparathyroidism, Calcijex&#174;,
and Survanta&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Lupron&#174;,
also marketed as Lucrin&#174;, and Lupron Depot&#174; used for the palliative treatment
of advanced prostate cancer, treatment of endometriosis and central precocious
puberty, and for the preoperative treatment of patients with anemia caused by
uterine fibroids;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Ogastro&#174;,
also marketed as Prevacid&#174; (lansoprazole), a proton pump inhibitor for the
short-term treatment of duodenal ulcers, gastric ulcers, and erosive
esophagitis; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>various
cardiovascular products, including Mavik&#174; (also marketed as Goptin&#174;), Isoptin&#174;
and Tarka&#174; for the treatment of hypertension.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Pharmaceutical Products segment markets its
products worldwide and generally sells its products directly to wholesalers,
government agencies, health care facilities, and independent retailers from
Abbott-owned distribution centers and public warehouses. Certain products are
co-marketed or co-promoted with other companies. Some of these products are
marketed and distributed through distributors. This segment directs its primary
marketing efforts toward securing the prescription of Abbott&#146;s brand of
products by physicians. Managed care providers (for example, health maintenance
organizations and pharmacy benefit managers) and state and federal governments
and agencies (for example, the Department of Veterans Affairs and the
Department of Defense) are also important customers.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\fc\5212583598_D11263_1741329\1583-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb 21 12:59 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition in the
Pharmaceutical Products segment is generally from other health care and
pharmaceutical companies. The search for technological innovations in
pharmaceutical products is a significant aspect of competition in this segment.
The introduction of new products by competitors and changes in medical
practices and procedures can result in product obsolescence in the
Pharmaceutical Products segment. Price can also be a factor. In addition, the
substitution of generic drugs for the brand prescribed has increased
competitive pressures on pharmaceutical products which are off-patent.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Diagnostic Products<a name="DiagnosticProducts_094902"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Diagnostic Products segment&#146;s products include
diagnostic systems and tests for blood banks, hospitals, commercial
laboratories, physicians&#146; offices, alternate-care testing sites, plasma protein
therapeutic companies, and consumers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The principal
products included in the Diagnostic Products segment are:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>immunoassay
systems, including ARCHITECT&#174;, AxSYM&#174;, IMx&#174;, Abbott Quantum&#153;, Commander&#174;,
Abbott PRISM&#174;, TDx&#174;, and TDxFlx&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>chemistry
systems such as ARCHITECT&#174; c8000&#174; and Aeroset&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>assays
used for screening and/or diagnosis for drugs of abuse, cancer, therapeutic
drug monitoring, fertility, physiological diseases, and infectious diseases
such as hepatitis and HIV;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
Vysis&#174; product line of genomic-based tests, including the PathVysion&#174; HER-2
DNA probe kit and the UroVysion&#153; bladder cancer recurrence kit;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a
full line of hematology systems and reagents known as the Cell-Dyn&#174; series;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
product line of FreeStyle&#174; blood glucose monitoring meters, test strips, data
management software and accessories for people with diabetes, including
FreeStyle&#174;Freedom&#153;, FreeStyle&#174;, FreeStyle Flash&#174; (sold in certain international
markets as FreeStyle&#174; Mini), FreeStyle Papillon&#153;, and FreeStyle Tracker&#174;, and
other blood glucose monitoring meters, test strips, data management software
and accessories, including Precision Xtra&#153;, MediSense Optium&#153;, Precision PCx&#174;,
Precision Q.I.D.&#174;, MediSense II&#153;, TrueMeasure&#174; strips, Precision Link&#174; Direct,
and Precision&#174; Sure-Dose&#174; insulin syringes; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
i-STAT&#174; point-of-care diagnostic systems and tests for blood analysis,
including the i-STAT&#174; system.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, under its strategic alliance with Celera
Diagnostics, a business of the Celera Genomics Group of Applera Corporation,
the Diagnostic Products segment develops, manufactures and markets a broad
range of <i>in vitro</i> molecular
diagnostic products for disease detection, disease progression monitoring, and
therapy selection. Through a sales and marketing agreement with Enfer
Scientific Ltd., the Diagnostic Products segment also distributes diagnostic
tests in Europe and Japan that are used to detect bovine spongiform
encephalopathy (BSE) in cattle.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Diagnostic Products segment markets its products
worldwide. These products are generally marketed and sold directly to
hospitals, laboratories, clinics, and physicians&#146; offices from Abbott-owned
distribution centers and public warehouses. Outside the United States, sales
are made either directly to customers or through distributors, depending on the
market served. Blood glucose monitoring meters and test strips for people with
diabetes are also marketed and sold over-the-counter to consumers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Diagnostic Products
segment&#146;s products are subject to competition in technological innovation,
price, convenience of use, service, instrument warranty provisions, product
performance, long-term supply contracts, and product potential for overall
cost-effectiveness and productivity gains. Some products in this segment can be
subject to rapid product obsolescence. Although Abbott has benefited from
technological </font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\fc\5212583598_D11263_1741329\1583-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb 21 12:59 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">advantages
of certain of its current products, these advantages may be reduced or
eliminated as competitors introduce new products. Certain of this segment&#146;s
products are subject to restrictions on their sale in the United States under a
consent decree entered in 1999. The consent decree is discussed in the section
captioned, &#147;Regulation&#148; on pages 7 through 9</font>.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nutritional
Products<a name="NutritionalProducts_095026"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nutritional Products segment&#146;s products include a
broad line of pediatric and adult nutritionals manufactured, marketed and sold
worldwide. These products are sold directly to consumers, often on the
recommendation or prescription of physicians or other health care
professionals, and to health care facilities and government agencies. The
segment also includes specialty pharmaceuticals.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principal products
in the Nutritional Products segment include:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>various
forms of prepared infant formula and follow-on formula, including
Similac&#174;Advance&#174;, Similac&#174;, Similac&#174; With Iron, Similac&#174;2, Isomil&#174; Advance&#174;,
Isomil&#174;, Isomil&#174;2, Alimentum&#174;, Similac&#174; NeoSure&#174;, Gain&#174;, and Abbott Grow&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>adult
and other pediatric nutritional products, including Ensure&#174;, Ensure Plus&#174;,
Ensure&#174; High Protein, Glucerna&#174;, ProSure&#174;, PediaSure&#174;, and Pedialyte&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>nutritional
products used in enteral feeding in health care institutions, including
Jevity&#174;, Osmolite&#174;, and Nepro&#174;;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
pharmaceutical product Survanta&#174;; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Zone
Perfect&#174; bars and the EAS family of nutritional brands, including AdvantEdge&#174;
and Myoplex&#174;.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nutritional Products segment&#146;s products are
distributed from Abbott-owned distribution centers or public warehouses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The segment generally sells nutritional products
directly to retailers, wholesalers, health care facilities, and government
agencies. Primary marketing efforts for nutritional products are directed
toward securing the recommendation of Abbott&#146;s brand of products by physicians
or other health care professionals. In addition, certain nutritional products
sold as Isomil&#174; Advance&#174;, Gain&#174;, Abbott Grow&#174;, PediaSure&#174;, Pedialyte&#174;, Ensure&#174;,
Glucerna&#174;, Zone Perfect&#174;, and EAS&#174; are promoted directly to the public by
consumer marketing efforts. These products are generally sold directly to
retailers and wholesalers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The segment&#146;s pharmaceutical products are generally
marketed directly to physicians, health care facilities, and government
agencies and sold through wholesalers. Primary marketing efforts for this
segment&#146;s pharmaceutical products are directed at securing the prescription of
these products by physicians.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition for
nutritional products in the segment is generally other diversified consumer and
health care manufacturers. Competitive factors include consumer advertising,
formulation, packaging, scientific innovation, price, and availability of
private label product forms. Competition for pharmaceutical products in the
segment is generally from other health care and pharmaceutical companies. A
significant aspect of competition is the search for technological innovations.
The introduction of new products by competitors and changes in medical
practices and procedures can result in product obsolescence. In addition, the
substitution of generic drugs for the brand prescribed has increased
competitive pressures on pharmaceutical products which are off-patent.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\fc\5212583598_D11263_1741329\1583-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb 21 12:59 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vascular Products<a name="VascularProducts_095055"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Vascular Products segment&#146;s products include a
broad line of coronary, endovascular and vessel closure devices used in the
treatment of vascular disease. In April&nbsp;2006, Abbott acquired Guidant
Corporation&#146;s vascular intervention and endovascular solutions businesses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The principal
products included in the Vascular Products segment are:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Multi-Link
Vision&#174;, and Multi-Link Mini Vision&#174;, coronary metallic stents;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Xience
V&#174;, a next-generation drug-eluting coronary stent system developed on the
Multi-Link Vision platform;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>BMW&#174;
and Asahi coronary guidewires;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>StarClose&#174;,
a vessel closure device;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Acculink&#174;/Accunet&#174;
and Xact&#174;/Emboshield&#174;, carotid stent systems; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Voyager&#174;
balloon dilation products.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Vascular Products segment markets its products
worldwide. These products are generally marketed and sold directly to hospitals
from Abbott-owned distribution centers and public warehouses. Outside the
United States, sales are made either directly to customers or through
distributors, depending on the market served.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Vascular Products
segment&#146;s products are subject to competition in technological innovation,
price, convenience of use, service, product performance, long-term supply
contracts, and product potential for overall cost-effectiveness and
productivity gains. Some products in this segment can be subject to rapid product
obsolescence. Although Abbott has benefited from technological advantages of
certain of its current products, these advantages may be reduced or eliminated
as competitors introduce new products.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">TAP Pharmaceutical
Products Inc.<a name="TapPharmaceuticalProductsInc__095105"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under an agreement between Abbott and Takeda
Pharmaceutical Company, Limited of Japan (Takeda), TAP Pharmaceutical Products
Inc. (owned 50&nbsp;percent by Abbott and 50&nbsp;percent by an affiliate of
Takeda), together with its subsidiary, TAP Pharmaceuticals Inc. (TAP), develops
and markets pharmaceutical products primarily for the United States. TAP
markets Lupron&#174;, an LH-RH analog, and Lupron Depot&#174;, a sustained release form
of Lupron&#174;, in the United States. Lupron&#174; and Lupron Depot&#174; are used
principally for the palliative treatment of advanced prostate cancer, for the
treatment of endometriosis and central precocious puberty and for the
preoperative treatment of patients with anemia caused by uterine fibroids. TAP
also markets Prevacid&#174; (lansoprazole), a proton pump inhibitor. Its principal
indications are for short-term treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease,
duodenal ulcers, gastric ulcers, and erosive esophagitis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">TAP&#146;s products are generally sold directly to
physicians, retailers, wholesalers, health care facilities, and government
agencies. In most cases, they are distributed for TAP from Abbott-owned
distribution centers. Primary marketing efforts for pharmaceutical products are
directed toward securing the prescription of TAP&#146;s brand of products by
physicians. Managed care purchasers (for example, health maintenance
organizations and pharmacy benefit managers) are increasingly important
customers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition is generally from other pharmaceutical
companies. A significant aspect of competition is the search for technological
innovations. The introduction of new products by competitors and changes in
medical practices and procedures can result in product obsolescence. Price can
also be a factor. In addition, the availability of over-the-counter drugs or
the substitution of generic drugs for the brand prescribed has increased
competitive pressures.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
